meanings.definition: A system for deducting union dues or other payments directly from an employee's wages.
meanings.sent1: The checkoff made it easy for me to pay my union dues without any hassle.
meanings.sent2: Don't forget to put a checkoff on your form to ensure your payment is deducted correctly.
meanings.sent3: The checkoff on my paycheck always reminds me of my commitment to the union.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to the cause was as clear as a checkoff on a pay stub.
meanings.sent5: The checkoff system streamlines the process of collecting dues for the union.

meanings.definition: A mark or tick indicating that something has been noted or completed.
meanings.sent1: I put a checkoff next to each task on my list as I finish it.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to add a checkoff to your checklist once you finish each item.
meanings.sent3: The checkoff on the document showed that the task was successfully completed.
meanings.sent4: Her completion of the project was as satisfying as a checkoff in a box.
meanings.sent5: The checkoff symbolizes progress and completion in a clear and simple way.

meanings.definition: To mark or indicate an item on a list as completed or verified.
meanings.sent1: I always checkoff each item on my to-do list to keep track of my progress.
meanings.sent2: Remember to checkoff the tasks you have finished before moving on to the next.
meanings.sent3: She decided to checkoff the items on her list in rainbow colors for fun.
meanings.sent4: His completion of the project was like a painter carefully checkoff each stroke.
meanings.sent5: Checkoff each step of the process to ensure nothing is missed or overlooked.
